intro: Tetracmidion glochidiatum, commonly known as the glochidiate tetracmid, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its composite flower heads, which consist of both ray and disk flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, sandy soils and is found in arid regions of North America. Its leaves are often narrow and covered in fine hairs, which help reduce water loss. The species is of interest to botanists due to its unique adaptations to harsh environmental conditions.
